subject: Communication
title: The 90-Second Rule
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: The 90-Second Rule.

hook.text: Neuroscientist Jill Bolte Taylor discovered that any emotion ‚Äî anger, fear, rage ‚Äî lasts only 90 seconds chemically.

buildup.text: After 90 seconds, the initial chemical surge (adrenaline, cortisol) dissipates.

discovery.text: If you're still angry after 90 seconds, you're choosing to replay the mental story that re-fires the emotional circuit.

twist.text: This means the pause is everything. Waiting 90 seconds before responding can transform your entire reaction.

climax.text: De-escalation techniques ‚Äî deep breaths, counting, walking away briefly ‚Äî all exploit this 90-second biological window.

punchline.text: Emotions are visitors. After 90 seconds, you're the one who invites them to.
